citations.narrative:
There was an approximately 12-18 inches high pile of miscellaneous items inside the lynx primary enclosure at the time of
the inspection including wooden boards, cleaning implements (rake and broom), and a section of tubing. According to the
licensee, these items are to be discarded as trash.
Per this Section, premises shall be kept clean to facilitate housekeeping and prescribed husbandry practices set forth in
this subpart and to protect the animals from injury. In addition, accumulations of trash shall be placed in designated areas.
These housekeeping requirements are important for the health and well-being of the animals. Animal housing/primary
enclosures should not contain trash, waste, and discarded materials. These miscellaneous discarded items need to be
removed from the primary enclosure. Correct by 3/28/25.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with Licensee.
*END OF REPORT*
n

narrative:
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
There was an approximately 12-18 inches high pile of miscellaneous items inside the lynx primary enclosure at the time of 
the inspection including wooden boards, cleaning implements (rake and broom), and a section of tubing. According to the 
licensee, these items are to be discarded as trash. 
 
Per this Section, premises shall be kept clean to facilitate housekeeping and prescribed husbandry practices set forth in 
this subpart and to protect the animals from injury. In addition, accumulations of trash shall be placed in designated areas. 
These housekeeping requirements are important for the health and well-being of the animals. Animal housing/primary 
enclosures should not contain trash, waste, and discarded materials. These miscellaneous discarded items need to be 
removed from the primary enclosure. Correct by 3/28/25. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with Licensee.  
 
*END OF REPORT*
